website_summaries.verdict: A super affordable price point and sturdy chrome construction make this basic potato masher from Good Cook an appealing choice.
pros: Good for guacamole and deviled egg processing
Chrome coating resists sticking, and is machine washable
Affordable addition to a basic kitchen tool set
cons: Handle is very short – hands could get close to hot food
Rounded bottom edges can trap food particles

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: I should have paid better attention to the listed dimensions for this masher—it's much smaller than I expected and need. The mashing prongs are only about the size of a small potato (see photo, candy bar for scale); it takes much more time and effort to crush a big pot of boiled potato chunks. The metal is on the lightweight side and the plastic handle feels hollow: this isn’t a quality kitchen tool.
customer_reviews.author: LegoGirl

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little potato masher!
customer_reviews.text: After my potato masher from the 70’s finally broke, I purchased this one as a replacement. I am in love with how streamlined this thing is. I can actually put it in a drawer without an ongoing wrestling match with the other utensils!
customer_reviews.author: km2008

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and simple to clean
customer_reviews.text: Love this. Unlike the classic masher with diamond-shaped holes, it doesn't get clogged with hard to clean potatoes, etc. Also great for breaking up ground meat for tacos, spaghetti sauce and breaking up whole or diced tomatoes.
customer_reviews.author: willmaof2

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to clean for first use
customer_reviews.text: The masher works just fine, but I struggled to get the glue used to stick the label on the masher off. I tried to peel the glue off and later soaked it in soap. I did use the masher eventually but in retrospect would have just bought something in a store so I could inspect it.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Leano

customer_reviews.title: This Potato Masher is the worst Masher I've ever bought in my life
customer_reviews.text: This Potato Masher is the worst Masher I've ever bought in my life. I've used it once and now it's rusty. I will never buy any products from this brand ever again....
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: poor quality / QA, sad
customer_reviews.text: a very sharp edge on the smashing part - it's like a drip of chrome that was not finished. jagged. It was able to pop the inflatable air cushions that amazon shipped it with. looking closer at the chrome of the smasher part, many blemishes and etchings - other than the one mentioned above. i know the description says 9" - but it is alarmingly small, like what i would give to a child to help smash potatoes. made in china. too much effort (for me) to send back. in the junk drawer it goes.
customer_reviews.author: thomas m cook

customer_reviews.title: Mash and Mash Somemore
customer_reviews.text: Our potato masher ended up somehow in that place with all the matching socks and other missing items in the house. We bought this one and when we got it, we were not disappointed. It is very sturdy metal and connected securely to the handle. It fits well into the hands of adults and children and makes quick work of whatever you need to mash. I recommend this masher to anyone looking for a sturdy metal masher.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Keep it simple
customer_reviews.text: Simple and time-tested design, comfortable grip, rips through mashables like a chainsaw. My wife had a teflon version of a masher that would bend under pressure and clog up the pass-through slots... needless to say it's gone and replaced with this item.
customer_reviews.author: JTGB

customer_reviews.title: Works Solidly
customer_reviews.text: Works good. It's not perfect but it definitely does the job. The one complaint? I just wish it were a little bigger is all.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Raburn

customer_reviews.title: Not durable.
customer_reviews.text: The second time using this product the metal bent and became misshapen. The day after the return period closed of course. It is still functional but not as easy to mash with as it should be. Hoping the metal doesn't continue to bend to the point it's unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: got for my mom
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my mom who at 88 is still living pretty independently. She loves her mashed potatoes so I got her this to make them and she loves it. lightweight and works really well too. very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: SMS

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: First off i waited 2 weeks for this.... just to get a child sized potato masher.... really?? I think ive seen plastic kids toy mashers bigget than this. And its made so cheaply! Next time ill just go to the store lol
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Derian

customer_reviews.title: Hulk mash!!
customer_reviews.text: Great simple look, strong and hasn’t broken yet/ doesn’t feel like it will. I like.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Santiago

customer_reviews.title: Nice addition to the kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this for various purposes other than mashing potato. It does the job and is durable.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Guacamole made fast
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive, versatile. My daughter was amazed how much faster and easier it was to mash avocados to make guacamole when she used mine so I bought one for her.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Huck

customer_reviews.title: Great my first masher
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product so far and has done the job. It’s my first masher so I give it good ratings
customer_reviews.author: Leandro.L

customer_reviews.title: As potato mashers go, this is a solid masher
customer_reviews.text: What can you say about a potato masher? It does the job. I've mashed a lot of potatoes with it. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: LelaKay

customer_reviews.title: Smashing the competition
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never loved a potato masher as much as I love this one! My life has changed for the better. I might quit my job so I can make more mashed potatoes.
customer_reviews.author: Superman_mpls

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I like things done the old fashioned way! It mashes potatoes and other things! It seems to be a good value!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we wanted.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! Glad to have one in my kitchen again. You never know how useful they are until you are with out one haha. Worth the month. Good price. Made well. Shipped fast.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Adams

customer_reviews.title: You will need to keep your kids back as they will want to use it and it's fun
customer_reviews.text: Now I can mashed potatoes just like my grandma used to lots of fun and you can put the kids to work
customer_reviews.author: Lauri Olin

customer_reviews.title: Mashed potatoes
customer_reviews.text: Always like mine and at Christmas my sister did not have one,Doha’s now!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Got this in the mail, washed it immediately and put it away. Went to use it for the first time tonight and noticed the coating on it was flaking... I haven’t even used it yet. Obviously won’t use it now, as I don’t want it chipping off into my food.
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Nothing fancy but certainly effective.
customer_reviews.text: Simple but effective. Sturdy and durable. I use this thing all the time for making refried beans and it takes a workout when I use it. I'm very pleased with it's performance.
customer_reviews.author: Tiger88

customer_reviews.title: Potato Masher
customer_reviews.text: Have another masher who's head resembles a waffle iron, but when I'm mixing dough, it was a chore to mash with. Now that I have the wire masher, it's a lot easier. All what I expected of it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It may not be a super fancy one but it gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: It may not be a super fancy one but it gets the job done! The price is perfect I compared to those at Walmart and other discount stores like Big Lots and it beat their prices! Thanks this is a must have in every kitchen
customer_reviews.author: marissa s jones

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy masher!
customer_reviews.text: If you like to mash potatos, this is a GREAT masher- many are very flimsy and ive broken a few just using a little force so this is a great one for home use. If youre a professional cook, youd probably want more but this taes a pretty good workout and does the job!
customer_reviews.author: Never bored mama

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and handy
customer_reviews.text: It's a grrat, basic masher I use it for deviled eggs and guacamole as well as potatoes and it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Bri

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Been wanting to make real mashed potatoes for awhile, this did a wonderful job. Mashing the potatoes has always been the hardest part for me, but this did such a wonderful job, and the mashed potatoes turned out perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Sara Goss

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality!
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for a month now it got so rusted. We clean it immediately asfter use and airdry but it started to be rusty and now I don’t know how I would use this on my baby’s food.
customer_reviews.author: Haibui

customer_reviews.title: Works fine but the handle is rather short
customer_reviews.text: Works fine but the handle is rather short. If you have a deep pot you could end up with your hands in the potatoes.
customer_reviews.author: Leesa Jones

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Don't use on raw spuds. Boil them 1st. It mashes them spuds just right!
customer_reviews.author: B. Bird

customer_reviews.title: Does The Job
customer_reviews.text: This is a potato masher like my mom used to own and she made great mashed potato's, so I stuck with this style. If you're as sick of "fresh" frozen mashed as I am then this is perfect! Not too big and not too small, it mashes potato's without lumps in no time! Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Dorn

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked well mashing up my tatters. Worth the low price!
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: 100% recommended!
customer_reviews.text: We made a lot mashed potatoes, practical and a vital need of every house
customer_reviews.author: Deniz Sa.

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT buy this. I never even got a chance to use it. Threw it in the dishwasher before I put it in my utensil holder and it rusted over the next couple days!! Junk!
customer_reviews.author: VicW23

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Very nice. No complaints 👍🏽 It does what it’s supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Kristine Port

customer_reviews.title: Masher
customer_reviews.text: I really like mashers in this style. Its bent a little out of shape but that's ok it keeps on mashing
customer_reviews.author: johnny

customer_reviews.title: Good grater configuration, lousy overall though
customer_reviews.text: It's flimsy, made in China, food gets caught in the rolled bottom edge, and the last one fell apart quickly, but it's one of the few graters with one large panel for the long thin grating, so we put up with it.
customer_reviews.author: KShell

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's a potato masher. It does the job! Decent quality.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works fine but I think you can find it in stores near you.
customer_reviews.author: P. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's a potato masher. It mashes potatoes. :: thumbs up ::
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: No more mashing potatoes or bananas with a fork! I was so happy when Amazon put this in my recommendations as I had not been able to find a masher locally. Does the job, not a hassle to wash and the handle doesn't hurt my hands when using.
customer_reviews.author: Gabrielle Chung

customer_reviews.title: Probably better for smaller hands and lighter work
customer_reviews.text: This was a bit smaller than I expected. It also seems a bit flimsy. Probably better for smaller hands and lighter work. You get what you pay for though.
customer_reviews.author: tonilyn

customer_reviews.title: Great, efficient masher
customer_reviews.text: This is the most efficient masher I have found. Great value for the money!
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I'm a real guacstar now that I have this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Ted80pTop Contributor: Watches

customer_reviews.title: Serves its purpose
customer_reviews.text: It is only okay because the handle is super short. I didn't expect it to be so small. Too cheap to return so I'll stick to it.
customer_reviews.author: gunia

customer_reviews.title: potato masher
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I was looking for...I live in a very small place and this is not oversized, but sturdy, and such a good deal... :)

customer_reviews.title: tator masher great
customer_reviews.text: it works great and had a great price. im a country girl and ive been use to mashing my tators with a fork this saves so much time.
customer_reviews.author: vickie byrd

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This was very good for the price and it works very well!

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than I expected but for the price, it works well enough.
customer_reviews.author: DCupertino

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as expected. I love this potato masher and I use for everything I need to mash up, It works great!
customer_reviews.author: Debra J. Mongeau

customer_reviews.title: Smash!
customer_reviews.text: I have had one of these for years, my now grown children always loving it. They wanted one just like it for their homes. I was not sure if the item was even made anymore, inheriting mine from my father. I was thrilled to find one! My young adult children were thrilled too! It is perfect to mash the potatoes and to separate the ground meat in the pan! Bravo!
customer_reviews.author: Marie Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my 95 yr old Mom. She says it's just like the one she got as a wedding present > 60 yr ago. Can't find these in the stores, so it was great to get it here.
customer_reviews.author: K Williams

customer_reviews.title: rusty potatoes anyone?
customer_reviews.text: This masher worked fine initially, but after a few dishwasher cycles, it started rusting at the bottom. Unfortunately I didn't realize this until someone else pointed it out well after the fact, so I'm sure I got a nice dose of rust infused into my mashed potatoes. Avoid this and get a stainless steel masher instead.
customer_reviews.author: DereliqueMB

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I finally got a masher!!!! This tool works as advertised. LOL
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Solid mashed
customer_reviews.text: I have had a couple that have broke from the handle to metal this is solid.....just wish it was a little bigger.
customer_reviews.author: kim harris

customer_reviews.title: Takes a beating and keeps on mashing!
customer_reviews.text: The description is sort of misleading. At no point was I informed that you actually have to cook and peel the potatoes before you mash them. Needless to say, this thing can take some abuse. I pounded the heck out of 10 pounds of Idaho spuds that were fresh out of the bag! Next time I will boil them and peel them first. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: supebone411

customer_reviews.title: we are happy. We like lumpy mashed potatoes
customer_reviews.text: it works and does what it is supposed to do. we are happy.We like lumpy mashed potatoes.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The item was not smooth in some places and didn't ...
customer_reviews.text: The item was not smooth in some places and didn't seem fully chromed. The masher end was smaller than I've seen on most mashers, it is almost a smaller version of the standard size I usually see.
customer_reviews.author: H Calvert

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not as sturdy as I expected, but it mashes potatoes well.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: My potatoes are no more
customer_reviews.text: I smashed my potatoes with this and made mashed potatoes. They came out like they were mashed, and not as whole potatoes.
customer_reviews.author: babyjeans

customer_reviews.title: Fake metal peeled after 3 uses, You get what you pay for, China once again
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for, the metal started flaking off after 3 uses, I don't know if we ate it or if it was from washing with a mild sponge, no SOS pads used, we hand wash everything and don't waste time with dishwashers.
customer_reviews.author: E. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: It is a great masher for potatoes
customer_reviews.text: I did not have a Potato Masher before and I know it is kinda crazy. So I bought one for Thanksgiven and been using it since. It is a great masher for potatoes. Works very well, and it is cheap. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Does an okay job
customer_reviews.text: This potato masher does the job. My complaint is that the space between the masher is so wide that it still really takes a lot of work. It leaves lumps in the potatoes. I have to really mash for a long time for it to have only a few lumps, but even then since the spacing is so wide, a lot of potato (when mashed) still gets through.
customer_reviews.author: Dorina Bernard

customer_reviews.title: Lasted a few years, but now is very rusty
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality metal, apparently not designed to get wet. Not what you would expect from a tool designed to, you know, mash wet potatoes and then be washed in water.
customer_reviews.author: Cookies

customer_reviews.title: very nice, it's good for a strawberries or other berries ...
customer_reviews.text: very nice, it's good for a strawberries or other berries to mash it, because it leaves a little chunks and it's good for berries to eat, not for a mash potato though.
customer_reviews.author: Matilda G Allen

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: One doesn't expect a Cadillac for Ford prices so even though its low in price it works REALLY well. No issues like others proclaim I'd buy it again but don't expect to have to .
customer_reviews.author: Chicagocharley

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, had one like this for years and I finally broke the handle. I prefer these stand up slightly slanted styles as I mainly use it for cheese and have no problems with scraping my fingers. Nice variety of grating options for nutmeg, etc., built sturdy to last for years.
customer_reviews.author: xDebx

customer_reviews.title: I don't understand why this masher has so many positive ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand why this masher has so many positive reviews. It works but it feels very flimsy in your hand and the second time I sent it through the dishwasher it came out rusted. I picked up a KitchenAid brand one locally that was a few bucks more but feels more solid and hasn't rusted.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: It was smaller than I thought it would be when I ordered it but it mashes potatoes just fine and fits into a smaller bowl so I really like it
customer_reviews.author: Lila Wilkerson

customer_reviews.title: 10/10 would recommend
customer_reviews.text: This is an easy to hand wash, easy to hold, and high quality product. My wife uses this to make buffalo chickpea sliders and it gets the chickpeas to the right consistency

customer_reviews.title: rusty ol thing
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality but does what its intended use is. rusts if put in dishwasher, beware!

customer_reviews.title: Works Great

customer_reviews.title: Works like any other potato masher
customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done, and looks attractive in the kitchen. Not nearly as effective as a potato ricer, though.

customer_reviews.title: What a s'mashing time.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

They used some cheap stainless steel to make it. I do put it though the dishwasher though so I would recommend not machine washing it.

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: good potato masher. I can't really comment on this because (believe it or not) I bought it to keep in my rubber stamping room to tie bows with, so I am not using it for it's intended purpose, and there's nothing strenuous about tying bows. :)

customer_reviews.text: The verticals seem to be a little springy, but the unit mashes potatoes just fine. Handle is comfortable and seems sturdy enough. I've used it twice, with no problems.

customer_reviews.text: It does mash potatoes but if you want to get rid of all the lumps, you'll be mashing for a while. Other than that, solid product

customer_reviews.title: Why buy expensive when you can buy this

product_meta.title: Good Cook Classic 9-Inch Chrome Potato Masher
product_meta.description: Style Name:Masher25735 features: -chrome plated shank and head. -Molded "classic" Plastic handle. -Heavy-duty, durable construction. Product type: -masher.
